Key Match Events: Paul DeJong hit a two-run homer in the second inning
Maikel Garcia and Michael Massey contributed RBI singles in the seventh inning
A wild pitch added to the Royals' score in the seventh inning
James McArthur struck out four in two innings
The Royals' solid bullpen closed with five perfect innings following the rain delay
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals improved to a league-best 23-13 since the All-Star break
The Guardians had a nine-game lead on June 26 but dropped the first three games in this series
Cleveland had led the division since April 14 — 154 days — before losing nine of 12 and becoming just 17-21 since the break
For the Guardians, the focus is on the end of the season rather than the standings
The Royals' win came with a minor scare as All-Star shortstop Bobby Witt Jr. got hit on the right hand by a pitch
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland's first-year manager Stephen Vogt emphasized the importance of waiting until the end of the season to assess their position
Kansas City manager Matt Quatraro highlighted the team's competitiveness and their goal to win the division
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was delayed for 2 hours, 14 minutes due to rain
Paul DeJong, who came over in a trade with the White Sox in July, recognized the Royals have a special group
Royals starter Michael Lorenzen left in the second after straining his left hamstring while covering first base
Guardians RHP Alex Cobb threw three simulated innings in a live batting practice against minor leaguers before the game
